intro: Lobelia borleana, commonly known as the Borlean's lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. Lobelia borleana is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
